Reviews.Content: SHOCK  Booked at motel for convenience of proximity to airport due to travel commitments for following day. Based on price I expected that the establishment would not be top class, but was dismayed by the attitude of the Night Manager when I registered a complaint when the shuttle left us stranded at the airport and we had to get a taxi to the motel. the room was about backpacker standard,tiny but reasonably clean with minimal comforts, like no hand towels or toiletries apart from two miniature cakes of soap. Television provided some interest, while in the room,but only for about a quarter of an hour whilst we tried to get a picture that we could watch but alas no success. Breakfast was something to write home about. we were told by reception where and when breakfast was available so duly rolled up for breakfast to be imformed that we had to pay for it despite being booked in for bb ..It seems that reception should have given us vouchers when booking in but again??? Chipped Crockery ,no side plates ,no fresh cutlery for toast spreading ,two clapped out toasters meant standing in a queue if you wanted toast. For food there was a very minimal selection, which I would classify at about Soup Kitchen standard.What more could one say except that in future I will certainly read the reviews before I book accommodation.
Reviews.Author: troubledtrekker

Reviews.Content: Misleading claims This hotel advertises that it offers 5 days complimentary parking and I relied on this claim when I pre-booked and paid for my stay. On arrival, however this was refused and I had to find alternative parking. If you are considering staying at this hotel, I would recommend you not rely on their advertised claims.
Reviews.Author: CanberraStargazer

Reviews.Content: !!!Do not stay!!!! This has to be the second worst hotel I have stayed in ever. The room reminded me of a prison cell. The bathroom is not big enough to even have one person in.We were supposed to have had an airport transfer on arrival and was told when we got there that the airport bus stops at 11pm even though we called 30 min before that. The staff were rude and the building looks like a monopoly game house. Don't bother with this and spend the little bit extra on another hotel close to the airport.
Reviews.Author: uktravler

Reviews.Content: good enough only booked in for one night, flew in from Melbourne to get flight back to uk next day. so it was handy 5 minutes from terminal. Our room was on second floor in building across yard from reception, room had twin beds ,t.v., kettle and tea making facilities, en-suite was very small but done what it was supposed to do unles you are large framed and could be a tight squeeze. It was clean and cosy no problem as far as I was concerned. Went to restuarant for meal $71 for a burnt pizza and chips, and a raw t-bone with hard potatoes, but the chocolate pudding was nice, difficult to mess that up. Transfer to airport was $3. per person no hardship there dropped of at the door, driver friendly enough and helpful with the cases. Would not want to spend too much time there but as a place to stopover it was ok.
Reviews.Author: sandymc

Reviews.Content: Absolute hole - don't stay Small, tacky, way over priced for what you get, slum like. Words fail me! It was full (amazing, what a con and close to airport can do for business) - so full you need to queue at the check-out. First stay on a 23 day trip and the only hotel I didn't check on TripAdvisor. Silly me. They also charge a luggage fee for the shuttle to the airport. Stay anywhere else - sleep under a bridge.
Reviews.Author: Travelight_56

Reviews.Content: Below average but price OK Rooms are small but ok. Bed ok, Toilet/shower very small so if you are bigger than average you probably wont shower because you wont fit in.Arranged for an early wake up call to allow time to book in for an early flight departure. The call never happened, in fact we had to wake up the male receptionist to book us out before departing. Still maybe with the language problems maybe he thought early wake up call meant that we would wake him up early.Location is OK, only a few dollars to the international terminal by shuttle bus and the sailing club is within easy walking distance for good meals at a reasonable price so we did not have suffer the motel meals as mentioned in other reviews.
Reviews.Author: jimmyd3

Reviews.Content: One of the worst, do not go there !!! We booked a night at this place 8 Dec, as we had to pick up our son from airport early next morning. I should have taken notice of other reviews. The rooms were like a dog box, tiny, dirty bathroom and walls. Cracks in walls, one, cup, one glass for a double room. Tiny TV out of tune. Soap dispenser in tiny grotty shower was empty.Noisy A/C. No plug in sink. two star at the max. We are Aussies and felt ashamed that international visitors would land up in this dump of a motel. Transit motel at its worst. Checked out the dinner restaurant, menu - poor, so took a 3 min walk left out of motel to St.George Rowing Club, great meals and views, good value, better than motel restaurant. We paid $136 for a BB package, at breakfast which was a poor buffet, couple of cereals, canned fruit, scrambled egg, beans and bacon. A rip off even with expensive Sydney prices. Even breakfast was a problem, restaurant was run seperate from motel and new restaurant owner argued the fact that our package inc breakfast, wanted to charge us another $10. Had to visit reception again to clear that up. Actually reception was the best part of the place, pleasant. My wife and I have stayed ast hotels, motels, inns in many parts of the world. I would rate this place amongst the very worst. No wonder they are not part of a chain, who would have them.! Take my tip, stay in Mecure across the road.
Reviews.Author: LesMary

Reviews.Content: Best avoided We arrived at the airport at 9 p.m. Eventually a shabby courtesy bus picked us up. The driver was arguing over the phone with the hotel about the large numbers he had to pick up. On arrival at the hotel we were aghast to find the reception staff protected behind a floor to ceiling metal grill. We had to poke our paperwork through the gaps in the grill!! A fellow guest observed that things were better in downtown L.A. Room was poor, didn't smell clean.
Reviews.Author: henry1886

Reviews.Content: Where was the shuttle service to this hotel?? Well well well we learn from our mistakes, but will they learn from theirs? i booked this hotel unfortunately relying on the travel accomodation people at the airport. everything was pretty much booked when i got there and was left pretty much with this choice..i had little time to see sydney and couldnt believe that i spent half of that precious time waiting at the airport for the shuttle bus!! terrible service and then when those at front desk passed me to the manager he concluded that HE had been the bus driver. They kept changing the story until they were right. one minute they had told me they had regular service every hour, and the next minute they told me they didnt have an hourly service to the airport and my goodness!! there was no point in arguing except for taking my return shuttle back to the airport the next day and swear never to go back and never recommend this hotel. To think that i saw shuttle buses for Mercure all the time, and this hotel is right behind this hotel (sydney international airport inn).
Reviews.Author: cavallino

Reviews.Content: convenience to airport only We stayed here for 1 night prior to an international flight. I booked 2 rooms, neither were ready on check in, actually they had lost both bookings and an elderly couple's as well who had been there before us and were still waiting for them to find their booking. Rooms were very small and basic and while to some it may be a cheap place, comparing it to the 4.5 star Hotel in Bangkok where we stayed for less then half price of here per night well you know who's been had. Breakfast was nearly non existant, long wait on bacon and hot water which I know is trivial but really they could not get it together and the resturant was in no way busy. On check out they tried to charge 1 adult and 1 child in our group for breakfast they did not even turn up for. After arguing for 10 minutes that they were not even in the resturant, she left to see some one and came back ,grunted something at us and we left. We were not due to fly out until 2.30pm but left the Motor inn at 8.30am and opted to sit and wait at the airport instead of here.Can not really compliment this place. Only positives were the closeness to the airport, close to a park if you have children and the Rowers club up the street. If you arrive in the dark and leave in the dark it may be fine.
Reviews.Author: ellietia

Reviews.Content: Great club up the street We stayed here for one night before a flight in August and thought that, by comparison to other hotels in the area we got what we paid for. We stayed at the IBIS last year which cost $250.00 and although the foyer was better the rooms were just as cramped. GIven that our purpose was to have a bed for the night and somewhere to park our car for the week, this place was ok. I have actually just booked another night in November prior to a flight. For $169.00 we get a bed for the night and 7 nights parking. The seven nights parking at the airport is $109.00 so for $60.00 we are getting a bed for two adults and one child, $20.00 per person.The Mecure across the road quoted $263.00 for the same package., and the Holiday Inn quoted $289.00 My advice to cope with staying at this place is that there is a great playground and park adjacent which was great for my five year old, and contrary to the reports on this site there is a great sailing club about 5 mins walk, overlooking the river where the beer is cold and the food is excellent and well-priced. So my plan is to use the $94.00 I saved by not staying at the Mecure on a nice meal and a few beers to give me the courage needed to return to the hotel. The room we stayed in was small, but no smaller than the IBIS. We went to bed late, got up and showered and left on the shuttle at 5.30am. This is not a place where you relax in luxury surroundings in a well-appointed room (or any other part of the hotel for that matter), but for our need of a bed and parking, even knowing what it is like, by comparison we have booked again.We had no trouble with the shuttle, drp off to the airport was booked when we checked in and when we arrived back at the airport we called and they showed up in about 20 mins.
Reviews.Author: jodi06

Reviews.Content: Great for an early flight I dont know what people expect from this hotel, we found it cheap and convenient place to stay overnight for an early international flight. The staff were helpful enough to explain where to find good restaurants and pubs in Brighton Le Sands, and to notify us about issues with APEC. Parking was handy and the airport is literally two minutes awat. The rooms were clean and just what we required - a bed, shower and TV. If you want luxury you would stay in the CBD.
Reviews.Author: GF8

Reviews.Content: Words are not enough... It was worse than faulty towers. The food, a simple vegie curry tasted as though it had been in the freezer for two years and the pizza a simple fare was sparse, tasteless and expensive. The worst thing about the restaurant was that the cultery was dirty. The mugs all out for the breakfast were all old ones from when this place was I'm assuming an aged persons hostel accomodation. I'm thinking that because when you had a shower in our bathroom the chair was still there to sit on whilst you had a shower and all the water went across the floor so all was soggy if unfortunately you had to use the toilet or basin. If you paid with WOTIF do not sign again with your card details. The hotel deducted another $100 from my visa, many travellers would miss this if they were travelling. The manager was not even apologetic, with some excuse that it is a testing mechanism. The shuttle system collapsed when the driver, took off in anor van and didn't even tell the seated passengers that were waiting for him. Under no circumstances stay here....
Reviews.Author: MinkieCanberra

Reviews.Content: don't stay at this hotel I stayed at this hotel as an overnight stopover in Sydney to catch a flight the next morning. both myself and my colleague was exceptional disappointed. There is no ambience in the hotel. There is no lift, so heavy bags are difficult to get to the upper floor. The restaurant food was terrible. I ordered the chicken pasta, but it tasted like a tin of tuna. As there is nothing else within walking distance you are stuck with what they have. The room was no better. The tap fell off in the shower, there was a light hanging from the wall by its electrical cord. I complained to the restaurant manager about the meals, but he wouldn't do anything. I also complained to the manager the next morning, but he also wouldn't do anything. When I was complaining to the manager, another guest also joined the discussion as she had also experienced problems. The manager wouldn't do anything about her issues either. He just told us both it was our fault for not saying anything about the problems in the evening.
Reviews.Author: blackbirdqld

Reviews.Content: Disgusting Hotel!!! This place is an absolute dive!!!. First i was told i was staying in a king room only to find that the bed was 2 singles with a sheet over the top, so you fell between the two beds. The t.v wouldn't work because the remote was broken. There were toe nails on the floor  the garbage bin still had rubbish in it. We had room service for dinner  the food was disgraceful, i think we paid $40 for 2 pasta's  you wouldn't feed it to your dog. We were also charged $6 to have the food brought to the room. I would never consider staying here again, an absolute dive!!!
Reviews.Author: golfpunk2000

Reviews.Content: Stay at your peril This hotel is the pits, staff are ignorant, rooms are so basic, it's a poor excuse for a hotel. TV a waste of time unless you have 10 times magnifying glasses, I would definately recommend you don't stay here! all these bad reviews can't all be wrong!!!
Reviews.Author: L16gsy

Reviews.Content: absolutely crap I have never felt the need to ever write a review, but i feel the need as this hotel is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. I do not know where to start, we knew we were in trouble when the shuttle bus picked us up, (late i might add) it was a disgrace, should not be used for transporting people.. The hotel staff were rude and honestly i can't believe I am in Australia. We paid extra for the suite as we were on our first night of our honeymoon.. If that was the suite i would hate to see the others.. Dinner was revolting roasted beef with three week old vegetables, my husband would never knock back any food, but he wouldn't eat it..Breakfast was no better in fact it was allready out at dinner, go figure....The funny thing was the majority of the breakfast patrons were complaining they didn't care that staff could hear them.. Dried out cereal, stale toast, sloppy god knows what,(i think they were eggs). Macca's at the airport for us thanks.. going onto wotif to get a bargain, did not pay off this time... DONT EVER GO THERE.....
Reviews.Author: sage72

Reviews.Content: Avoid! My thoughts on this place mirror those of the other reviewers and the only reason why I give it 2 instead of 1 is because of the closeness to the airport. As with all airport hotels around the world we are a captive audience and the prices are ridiculous for what you get. This hotel is particularly bad because when we stayed for one night at the beginning of January 2007, the price was high AND the place was dire.I don't know where the staff are recruited from (?) but they have no idea what they are doing. I asked if I could iron a shirt in the laundry which turned out to be a grotty broom cupboard containing rubbish, mounds of fluff and a grubby iron and ironing board which had seen much better days. The staff were loitering around the hotel in what I can only describe as shifty poses, doing nothing - who is the manager here??Our room was in the older building which was awful with piled up furniture in the lounge. There was a strange smell in the corridors and our room was not very nice at all.Thankfully we were leaving Sydney and not arriving, or I would have been very upset at my first glimpse of Oz having stayed at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: loopylady

Reviews.Content: Tragedy There is little that I need to add to recent reviews of this apology of an 'International' motor inn. All the deficiencies noted in earlier reviews were alive and well on Saturday 10 March when my wife and I checked in after a 12 hour flight.We had waited for almost an hour for the hotel shuttle to arrive, despite frequent calls to check on its progress. We were initially advised that the shuttle would be there 'in a few minutes' but eventually the front desk took to ignoring our calls.I won't dwell further on the unhelpful staff, musty rooms and inadequate breakfast, however it is worth noting that the bar shut at 1000 pm on the Saturday night and we were refused service on arrival, just after 1000 pm, despite the presence of numerous patrons. The airport shuttle costs $3 per person - to my knowledge the only Sydney airport hotel which charges for this service.The tragedy is that, presumably this is the first contact some overseas visitors have with Sydney and their experience is likely to be less than overwhelming.Sydney can do far better than this. My recommendation is to avoid this accommodation at all costs. In the worst case try a bench in the nearby international terminal - you will probably have a far more comfortable night.
Reviews.Author: binliner

Reviews.Content: Terrible for the price! The front desk staff were rude and unhelpful to start with.We were kept waiting an hour beyond check-in time for a room - not good for the weary traveller. No comfortable seating, TV or bar open to occupy the time - you're encouraged to go away and come back later!! Go where?Awful food in the restaurant - bad selection, terrible quality and expensive (especially for what you get). Room service is the same menu for $5.50 more.Loud and noisy airconditioning in the room for which maintenance does not materialise to fix - as promised by the rude and unhelpful front desk staff.No lights on in the corridor or stairwell outside the room - safety regulations?No toiletries provided - better bring your own!No exhaust fan in the bathroom either - steamy!We've stayed in a lot of hotels and this one is the WORST for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: ratherbehome

Reviews.Content: Absolutely appalling! What an awful hotel!!! My husband and I have travelled a lot and I have to say this would be the worst hotel we have ever stayed in!!!I flew in to Sydney in the evening ( my husband was already there) firstly we had to try to find a park (ok if you have a normal sedan but dont bother if you have a ute!!) and dodge the piles of construction rubbish laying all over the place and avoid the litter of feral kittens living in the rubbish!! Our room looked nothing like the brochure we saw, apparantly the room we were in was in the old part of the hotel. When we got to the room the bed was on the floor!!! The bathroom was VERY MOULDY.....on the walls above the shower, the shower curtain was slimy and mouldy, great health risk there, tissue dispenser had come free from its bracket on the wall and was just sitting on the bench and was as old as the hills. Shampoo was in a dodgy dispenser on the wall that anyone could have tampered with, TV selection was dismal to say the least, not everyone wants to watch static!! No restaurants nearby so we ended up ordering pizza! When we went down to breakfast the next morning there was very little to choose from and after half an hour the food had run out! And just to cap it off when I asked where the toilets were I was directed to a employee entrance where rubbish was piled up and the employees were sitting there smoking inside the building!!! And to finish our lovely experience off, after we returned home (this trip was a business all expenses paid trip) they had the audacity to charge our card for the room!! When I called them to ask why I was basically greeted with a who cares attitude!!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!! Pay the extra for a better hotel!!!
Reviews.Author: VicTraveller75

Reviews.Content: This place is a dump When we arrived there was an argument going on in reception between the manager and a dissatisified customer. The lift to our room was not working and there was another customer complaining that there was no food in the restraurant , you are right we should have left at this stage but we had just traveled from the gold coast and had to catch an early flight the next morning. The room was very cramped and stank of bleech , very obviously trying to hide the smell of somthing else ( maybe this was a blessing) there were cobwebs hanging from the curtains and a prehistoric air conditioning unit at the side of the single bed. I also noted that this room had no fire escape plan on display. sleeping on the floor of the airport would be preferable to sleeping here , and we would have if we didn't have children with us.
Reviews.Author: IrelandCarol

Reviews.Content: Nightmare Rooms  This hotel is an absolute nightmare!We booked a room with Wotif, and by looking at the photos this place looked like a nice place to stay before a big flight. However, when we arrived we found the rooms to be cramped, stark and there was a strong smell of mould  septic tank.The bathroom was dirty and the shower was broken. The washing liquid supplied had mould growing through it, the toilet wasn't clean and the tiles in the shower had caked soap scum and mould on the floor. Not good for someone who may have allergies and/or asthma!The TV was cheap and small, and their cable TV was badly tuned.The bed was lumpy, as were the pillows. There were some suspicious stains on the blankets and on the sides of the matresses, which were crudely covered up with sheets. The food was overpriced and disgusting. I ordered spaghetti bolognaise, however when it arrived the smell of misc. meat was strong - Certainly not worth $19! The seats and food in Economy class were luxury compared to this poor excuse for a hotel. If anyone is looking for a place to stay while waiting for their flight, you're better off going across the road to the Mercure - Go with a name you can trust and not an independent hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Go elsewhere My family and I stayed at this particular hotel for 1 night due to our flight leaving first thing the next morning from Sydney Airport. Upon arrival to our room, we couldnt help but notice that the room looks nothing at all like its pictures, and resembles more of a dank, musty confined space similar to a budget roadside inn. The main double bed was hard and unpleasant to sleep in, and there was an extra single bed pushed way into the corner of the room seemingly hiding the Air Conditioner in the lower wall that wasnt functional. This bed took up way too much space and wasnt included in the room description. The television was very small and barely veiwable due to poor reception- and as for the supposed Cable Television, there was about 2 or 3 channels other than the standard free to air- and even then they were channels that held no interest. The bathroom was not pleasent, small and lacking any charm- making trips to the shower and toilet as short lived as possible. The room service food was decent, but heavily over-priced for what is was worth. It seems the International Motor Inn knew full well that there is nowhere else to eat nearby, and having just travelled a few hours to sydney, We were hungry and left without option to pay the ridiculous food prices. We have stayed at the Hilton in Sydney before and payed less for a meal that was 5-star quality.Overall, we spent less than 10 hours at the actual inn, and we'll never return. Travellers beware- Although this hotel is cheap, You get alot less than what you pay for. 1 star.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: thanks, but no thanks I feel fortunate that I didn't have problems like the other reviewers but this place is defineately nothing special. My husband  I on our way to the gold coast needed a place to crash since our flight into Sydney arrived after all the connecting flights up north. I picked this one since it is the closest to the airport  it was the only one under $150.00  I just couldn't get myself to pay more than $100 to stay somewhere for 6 hours. The shuttle bus picked us up propmtly  were checked in quickly  our room was close by, the room was weird-however it was clean. It had REALLY old comforters  blankets. I felt like I was at my grandmas house with her 20 year old bedspread. also there was like a double bed  a twin bed in the one room. kinda weird. the next day we had some time to explore the city  they have a cubby hole type thing underneath their stairs in the lobby to store all our luggage in-which was a BIG help. They also took us back to the airport (with a AUD$3.00 per person fee) but cheaper than a cab! Okay for what we needed but wouldnt stay there again would spring for a place w food onsite...
Reviews.Author: managirl

Reviews.Content: pretty bad Pretty cheap but pretty bad. Found a BIG bug in our room. Very noisy due to slamming doors. Only quiet from 12:30am to 6am. 10 Minute walk brings you to the rail station and you can be downtown quickly. Shuttle was fine. Staff pleasant. Just too tacky. Won't stay there again.
Reviews.Author: SF49er

Reviews.Content: Worst accommodation ever Needed a place near this location for a meeting next morning. Checked in ok, several bits of paper needed to leave car in carpark (I could live with that). Booked 4star Botany room. Room smelled musty, room hot and airconditioner not effective and dripped water on carpet all night. (Hence the musty smell i guess!) Reported this to manager who fiddled and said drip would stop. wrong! Also complained abt suspicious stains on sheets. Manager said they were oil stains from the washing machine?? TV remote would not work, carpet filthy,cracks in walls roughly patched and sort of painted over. Complained again at reception next morn, but she couldn't care.Rating 1/10. Try somewhere else please
Reviews.Author: WPS111

Reviews.Content: Awful last night's experience for Australia I should have checked review's on this hotel as I usually do. I booked through a web site, can't remember which. I swore the room I booked said it was a two room superior family suite. When we got there, very tired, we were shocked! It was a room the size of a Motel Six with a queen sized bed, two twin beds and a pull out couch in the same room! You can imagine my dismay when I confronted the front desk, whom was already closing up at eleven o'clock, and they said they did not have any two bedrooms. Mind you we paid 205.00 AUD!!! The place was barren, there were 'no' elevators! We had seven pieces of luggage and they kind of just shrugged off the fact there was no easy way to get it upstairs. There were no restaurant's anywhere in sight either. The ony benefit was that the airport was across the street, but we didn't get there fast because they had so many people and so much luggage that they didn't load until the time we were scheduled to go, and the dumb little pieces of paper saying we paid. We only were there to sleep and it was our last night or we would have left on the spot. Don't say here unless you like an overpriced Motel Six!!
Reviews.Author: steffylew

Reviews.Content: This Place is a Dump The travel info. service at Sydney Airport referred us to this dump. The agent told us that it's a decent 3-star hotel for $99 AUD. After waiting for 30 min. for the hotel shuttle to pick us up, we found out that this place is more like a 1-star motel. I'm sure the agent at the airport received her nice commission. The room smelled stale  mildewey. The room's furnishings were old and tattered. The fan in the bathroom sounded like a jet engine. We used the internet kiosk in the lobby and lost $2 AUD, which management said it's not their kiosk. I wished I paid $10 more to stay at the Ibis.
Reviews.Author: Diem

Reviews.Content: Basic, but it fills its purpose Our stay here did not start well, as we had the wrong phone number (which I'm sure is the same as the one they gave us, as I always read a number back, but there is the possibility that it was my fault, so we didn't kick up a fuss) and couldn't contact the shuttle to pick us up. Ended up taking a taxi, and having to pay the driver $15.00 after he had a (fairly justified) tantrum about the short distance. There was no comment from the hotel about the wrong number, but the fare eliminated the price difference between this and the better places and put us in a resentful kind of mood. Keep that in mind when reading this review. The rooms at this hotel were very small - a twin barely fits two single beds and a small table. The television was cheap and tiny, the channels badly tuned in, and there was only minimal cable. However, the room windows opened, which was a definite plus. I bought a amke shift junk food dinner from the 7-11 at a local service station, as there was nothing else open in the entire area. Breakfast was very limited in scope, and expensive, and the waiter looked at me like I was an alien when I asked if they had skim milk. My advice is to take a walk over to the Mecure - it can't be any worse. All that said, however, I'm well aware that I was paying only $120.00 a night in a city were standard rooms are routinely over the $200.00 mark. With that in mind, this motel really isn't that bad. It also has some advantages. We flew out at 5pm the next day, and they willingly stored our bags, and allowed us to catch the shuttle back to the airport 鈥?a far easier task that catching the shuttle from the airport! The staff were also pleasant enough, especially given that they were clearly rushed off their feet. Comfy seats are provided for people waiting for the shuttle. I wouldn't exactly recommend this motel. However, in fairness it fills it's role as a dormitory hotel, close to the airport and suitable for people who are going places and don't intend to linger. Depending on the price of the competition 鈥?and do check! - it may not be all that bad a place a stay.
Reviews.Author: Carlydria

Reviews.Content: Not very good Shuttle was fine, rooms clean and small. Absolutely nowhere to go for food and breakfast was expensive. Would advise travellers to stay closer to town near the railway station rather than here unless you only want to sleep for a few hours.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid If Possible The hotel quotes $107-111 online but apparently offers $88 rooms according to another guest. It took about 35 minutes to process the new guests and the lobby has no maps to offer you, apart from their brochure which displays a trendy hotel. Our room had blank white walls and was in a building that, while having nice gardens around it, was dark and full of peeling paint inside. The breakfast was $14.50 for a Rice Bubbles (Krispies), Corn Flakes, Raisin Bran, ... and an extra $3 got you fake-tasting eggs, bacon, mysterious triangular potato objects, tasteless tomatoes, and baked beans. The management was incompetent, not telling you that you needed to get a silly scrap of paper to board the shuttle or arranging bookings. It is in Arncliffe, a depressing suburb off of major roads and away from any restaurants except in the nearby Mercure. Furthermore, our building key did not work and we had to wait for other people to open it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here Shuttle took 1 hour to pick us up - called 3 times at our expense. No apology from driver or management. Restaurant only buffet, 5 items for $25 each! (this was at 9:00 PM!) Room small, only 2 towels, 13 TV. Letter to manager was left with desk clerk. Never had a reply. Do not stay here unless you don't mind unreliable transportation and you do not plan on eating.
Reviews.Author: Labbysmom

Reviews.Content: 鍙倐銇亸涓嶅彲銈傘仾銇?#x201d;   showReview(21745005, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
